millsfield:images_texts:
PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS
introduces another "first" in
*
Sheporte
a luxurious new travel unit
with day and night comfort
• exclusively for trans-Pacific
passengers on the world-famous
FLYING CLIPPERS
* Patent applied for

EXPERIENCE THAT COUNTS
IN CROSSING THE WORLD'S
LARGEST OCEAN
Here's real take-it-easy comfort! Pan American's
Sleeperettes look more comfortable ... really are more
comfortable than ordinary seating.
You sink right into
the soft, luxurious, foam-rubber cushions. The curved
headrest comfortably supports your head.
Like a little social get-
together? Then ask
your neighbors to join
you. Sleeperette seats can
be turned around to face
each other. It's ideal for
family
groups or game
enthusiasts.
The fold-away table
(with a reading rack) can
be adjusted for cards and
other games, for reading,
writing or office work
such as typing; and busy
executives have "office'
privacy at any time.
Pioneer in the Pacific. In the 19 years since Pan American pio-
neered over-ocean transport, Flying Clippers have flown over
6 million passengers more than half-a-billion overseas miles.
That's equivalent to more than 71,000 Pacific crossings. First
airline to span this vast ocean (1935), Pan American today
serves the entire Pacific Basin.
Pioneer in service, too. In establishing the world's longest com-
mercial airlanes,
Pan American developed many important
trans-ocean services ... including long-range weather forecast-
ing, improved radio equipment, instrument flying and advanced
aerial navigation. Many other services have been introduced by
Pan American -from in-flight meals to steward service. And
now, the Sleeperette.
Time-tested equipment. Big, 4-engine Clippers serve you in the
Pacific. Douglas DC-4s that took the greatest flight test in the
history of aviation. Logging millions of miles under grueling
wartime conditions, the Douglas DC-4 was rated perfect for
performance, safety and durability.
Best-trained personnel. Your pilot? He's gone through the
world's most rigid training! He has averaged more than 1½
million miles in the air. He's the world's most experienced
over-ocean pilot. And he captains a seasoned multiple crew-
a vital safety factor.
Mighty handy at
mealtime - this ad-
justable table. There's
no balancing of tray on
lap. It adds to the enjoy-
ment of the delicious
meals and light snacks
served aloft ... and that
goes for beverages from
the bar, too.
WORLD - WIDE SAFETY RECORD
For logging 43,878,591 flying miles
without a single flight accident, Pan
American now holds the coveted
Aviation Safety Award for 1946.
After meals you can lean back, stretch out your legs
for restful relaxation, and ride through the skies - at
peace with the world. With Sleeperette comfort, great
distances in the Pacific become pleasant, easy hops.
Agent for
PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS
The System of the Hying Clippers
WORLD'S MOST EXPERIENCED AIRLINE
Lithographed in U.S. A.
P35-7
Copyright 1947, Pan American Airways, Inc.
1998.139.018
properties.sfomuseum:description: Brochure issued by Pan American World Airways, promoting “Sleeperette” service; yellow cover with illustration of woman reclining in aircraft passenger seat; interior describes "sleeperette" options such as upright seating, adjustable to fold-away table, leg rest, and lounge chair.
